item.title: Why not using Grunt.js?
item.description: The answer is very simple: i need to be more simple as possible. Grunt.js and Node.js are amazing tools, but i so simple as Jekyll is. You can use SCSS, on assets folder, but is totally optional. The CSS files in use are on stylesheets folder.

@import "compass/reset";
// variables
$colorGreen: #008000;

@mixin container {
        max-width: 980px;
}
// mixins with parameters
@mixin button($color:green) {
        @if ($color == green) {
                background-color: #008000;
        }
        @else if ($color == red) {
                background-color: #B22222;
        }
}
button {
        @include button(red);
}

item.title: SASa, a Jekyll theme
item.description:
Hello i’m a Jekyll Theme, build with SASa Block Grind!, a simple alternative to others great Jekyll themes like Scribble and Jekyll Bootstrap. The reason for this is only for didatic purposes.

I’m Open Source you can fork me or download me, and made the changes you want, BUT is much better if you contribute with me.

Contributing

  1. Fork it!
  2. Create your own branch
  3. Commit your changes
  4. Submit a pull request
